Articles.Content:
Hi all. Trying to launch the new 1.2 release on my Linux Laptop, I get the following :

  

$ ./KSP.x86_64 
Set current directory to /home/vince/Softwares/Games/KSP_linux
Found path: /home/vince/Softwares/Games/KSP_linux/KSP.x86_64
Mono path[0] = '/home/vince/Softwares/Games/KSP_linux/KSP_Data/Managed'
Mono path[1] = '/home/vince/Softwares/Games/KSP_linux/KSP_Data/Mono'
Mono config path = '/home/vince/Softwares/Games/KSP_linux/KSP_Data/Mono/etc'
displaymanager : xrandr version warning. 1.5
client has 4 screens
displaymanager screen (0)(DP-2): 1920 x 1080
Using libudev for joystick management


Importing game controller configs
The futex facility returned an unexpected error code.Aborted

and then back to bash prompt...

I never encountered this error before (the futex facility thing) and I have no clue what to do... Any idea ?

Running KDE on Debian Stretch

Thanks

Edited October 13, 2016 by macbernick

If you've upgraded from a previous release to 1.2, you may want to try the advice in this answer:

If that doesn't work, I'd suggest reading this thread to help gather more information that would be helpful diagnosing your problem.
Thanks for your fast answer. Yes removing both SQUAD and squad directories in ~/.config/unity3d/ fixed it. I didn't see this post before, I feel stupid. Thanks.
